goals.question: What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of bird strikes per year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the trend of bird strikes over the years and identify any patterns or anomalies.

goals.question: Which bird species is responsible for the most bird strikes?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of bird strikes by bird species
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the bird species that pose the greatest risk to aviation safety and inform measures to mitigate this risk.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes by time of day?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of bird strikes by time of day
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the times of day when bird strikes are most likely to occur and inform measures to reduce this risk.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes by aircraft type?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of bird strikes by aircraft type
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which types of aircraft are most vulnerable to bird strikes and inform measures to reduce this risk.

goals.question: What is the average cost of damage caused by bird strikes?
goals.visualization: Box plot of cost of damage caused by bird strikes
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range and distribution of costs associated with bird strikes and inform decisions about risk management and insurance.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Incident Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Incident Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Incident Date'])]
    data['Year'] = data['Incident Date'].dt.year
    yearly_birdstrikes = data.groupby('Year').size().reset_index(name='Frequency')

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='Year', y='Frequency', data=yearly_birdstrikes)
    plt.title('What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    species_count = data['Species'].value_counts().head(10)
    species_count = species_count.reset_index()
    species_count.columns = ['Species', 'Count']

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.barplot(x='Species', y='Count', data=species_count, palette='viridis')
    plt.title('Which bird species is responsible for the most bird strikes?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Bird Species')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Bird Strikes')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(title='Bird Species', labels=species_count['Species'], loc='upper right')

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['time_of_day'] = pd.to_datetime(data['time'], format='%H:%M:%S').dt.hour
    data['count'] = 1
    data_grouped = data.groupby(['time_of_day', 'species']).count().reset_index()

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.barplot(x='time_of_day', y='count', hue='species', data=data_grouped, ci=None)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of bird strikes by time of day?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Time of Day (Hour)')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Bird Strikes')
    plt.legend(title='Species', loc='upper right')
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    aircraft_counts = data['Aircraft_Type'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(aircraft_counts, labels=aircraft_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of bird strikes by aircraft type?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(aircraft_counts.index, title="Aircraft Types", loc="best")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.boxplot(data=data, y='Cost_of_damage')
    avg_cost = data['Cost_of_damage'].mean()
    plt.axhline(avg_cost, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Average Cost: {avg_cost:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the average cost of damage caused by bird strikes?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
